publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5645 Dennis Canavan: Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children—That the Parliament congratulates Falkirk Council on being the first local authority in the United Kingdom to introduce the Groupcall alert system in all its schools and urges other local authorities to follow Falkirk’s excellent example by introducing such a system which sends a message by text, phone or e-mail to parents if their children do not attend school. Supported by: Campbell Martin*

S2M-5645 Dennis Canavan: Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children—That the Parliament congratulates Falkirk Council on being the first local authority in the United Kingdom to introduce the Groupcall alert system in all its schools and urges other local authorities to follow Falkirk’s excellent example by introducing such a system which sends a message by text, phone or e-mail to parents if their children do not attend school. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Phil Gallie*, Cathy Peattie*, Robin Harper*, Michael Matheson*, Fiona Hyslop*, Brian Adam*, Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-5645 Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children (lodged on 22 February 2007) John Swinburne*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5645 Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children (lodged on 22 February 2007) Margaret Mitchell*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-5645 Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children (lodged on 22 February 2007) Frances Curran*, Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5645 Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children (lodged on 22 February 2007) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Mr David Davidson*

S2M-5645 Dennis Canavan: Groupcall Message Alert System for Parents of School Children—That the Parliament congratulates Falkirk Council on being the first local authority in the United Kingdom to introduce the Groupcall alert system in all its schools and urges other local authorities to follow Falkirk’s excellent example by introducing such a system which sends a message by text, phone or e-mail to parents if their children do not attend school. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Phil Gallie, Cathy Peattie, Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Fiona Hyslop, Brian Adam, Stewart Stevenson, John Swinburne, Mr Adam Ingram, Margaret Mitchell, Carolyn Leckie, Frances Curran, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mr David Davidson
